messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.talks

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=da0fbb7b011c&repo=talks ***

go.talks: add present-style slide decks

R=golang-dev, rsc, r
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6499061

How do you plan to organize talks in this repo?
I'm not sure that the method of delivery should be an organizing
principle, but right now it appears that 'slides' means 'talks written
with one specific tool'.
This ties in with the other CL too.

Maybe the talks should be organized by year, regardless of presentation method.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, rsc@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

On 1 September 2012 03:46, Russ Cox <rsc@golang.org> wrote:
> Maybe the talks should be organized by year, regardless of presentation method.

I took this approach.

subject: code review 6499061: go.talks: add present-style slide decks
